alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 09 at 8:15PM PST until January 10 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PST TUESDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TUESDAY TO 10 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents with elevated surf of 3 to 6 feet tonight. High surf of 5 to 8 feet Tuesday through Wednesday. Highest surf on west facing beaches. * WHERE...Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands, Malibu Coast and Los Angeles County Beaches. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from 6 AM Tuesday to 10 PM PST Wednesday. For the Beach Hazards Statement, until 6 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A strong west swell has created abnormally strong, very dangerous rip currents.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks. Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast
